title: Victims identified, suspect arrested in Little Rock triple shooting
content:
UPDATE (12:40 p.m.):
Little Rock police have arrested a man after a Monday morning shooting that left another man dead and two people injured.
Police say Denzel Terrell Braud, 23, was located a short distance away from the scene of the shooting. He was arrested without incident and will be charged with one count of capital murder, two counts of criminal attempt to commit capital murder, and two counts of first degree battery.
The man who was killed has been identified as Cordarell Collins, 22. Police say the injured woman is 21-year-old Alexis Davis. They confirmed the injured child is three years old. Davis and the child were both taken to local hospitals. Their conditions are unknown but they are expected to survive.
According to information from Little Rock police, Braud and the victims all lived in the apartment complex where the shootings took place.
Braud has been booked in the Pulaski County jail without bond.
-------------------------------------------------
ORIGINAL REPORT:
Little Rock police are investigating a Monday morning shooting.
Authorities were called to the Arkansas River Apartments complex located at 6900 Cantrell Road shortly before 7:30 a.m.
Little Rock police reported three people were shot. An adult female and a 3-year-old child were both shot and injured but are expected to live. An adult male died. The identities of the victims have not been released.
This is a developing story. Details will be released as more information becomes available.
